attributes.action: Ban the use of horses within the police force
attributes.background: We want to ban the use of horses within the police force. Often the horses are put into dangerous and uncontrolled situations such as football games or marches which leads to distress for the animal. The horse is being exploited and is not having the freedom which we have and take for granted.
attributes.additional_details: I recently witnessed a Police horse struggling to walk, looking in pain along with acting distressed as it walked down a busy main road in Manchester. It is unfair and there are other means the Police could have used such as bikes, as this was a quiet Wednesday evening there was no need to have the horse out. The policeofficer was not able to control the situation in a calm & effective manner to which the horse would be taken out of the dangerous situation for both the horse and the public.

attributes.action: Replace the compulsory GCSE English Literature subject with Computer Science.
attributes.background: An increasing number of jobs require IT and far more than English Literature.

attributes.action: Allow vehicle tax to remain with the vehicle upon transfer of ownership.
attributes.background:
When the DVLA stopped issuing paper tax disc the ability to transfer vehicle tax to a new owner was also removed. 
This means that in many cases the tax is paid by both the seller and buyer for the month the car changes hands.

attributes.action: Create option to sign in opposition to any Parliament and Government petition.
attributes.background: Currently it is only possible to sign in agreement or support of any petition that is put up on this website. This is an obstacle to balanced discussion especially in cases where a petition goes to Parliament for a debate. Essentially this would be similar to MPs 'opposing' a new law, bill, etc.
attributes.additional_details: If approved there would need to be review of the current rules regarding when a governmental response is needed (10,000 signatures) or parliamentary debate (100,000 signatures). Specifically would signatures in support of and in opposition be summed up or counted separately.

attributes.action: Appeal for the UN to ban Lethal Autonomous Weapons
attributes.background: Countries across the world are on the verge to finish artificially intelligent weapons by 2019. These machines will result in unfathomable consequences that humans cannot foresee. International legislation must be pressured by the UK to keep up to date before the technology is finished and utilised.
attributes.additional_details:
https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lethal_autonomous_weapon

https://autonomousweapons.org

https://futureoflife.org/2018/04/30/lethal-autonomous-weapons-an-update-from-the-united-nations/?cn-reloaded=1

https://www.janes.com/article/79311/china-s-shock-call-for-ban-on-lethal-autonomous-weapon-systems

attributes.action: The British people should have a referendum on abolishing the Monarchy.
attributes.background: The British people should be given a referendum to decide whether to keep the Monarchy or become a republic.
attributes.additional_details: The British public should be given a vote to decide whether to keep the Monarchy or not.

attributes.action: Teach schools about emotional & physical wellbeing, mental health & illnesses
attributes.background: I think it is very important that from a young age our children should be taught more about the effects of mental illness and show them a positive outlook on life through physical and emotional wellbeing. This can be yoga, meditation, holistic studies etc. Our children are our future!
attributes.additional_details: As a sufferer of mental illness from a very early age due to family problems & bullying, I think its vital that children should have the opportunity to be more educated on the affects of mental illness as it has such an impact on them in the future. Introducing wellbeing & complementary therapy classes to the curriculum I believe would help a lot of children understand how mental illness works and how to tackle it positively. I strongly believe that emotional and physical wellbeing is crucial.

attributes.action: Reconsider licence requirement for small breeders to safeguard endangered breeds
attributes.background: Many dog breeds are endangered and can’t afford to lose breeders. Small breeders with <2 litters yearly in the home are concerned about being unable to meet the expense and requirements of the new licensing laws and may be forced out of business if they chance to make more than £1k in any one year.

attributes.action: More training for teachers in supporting and identifying childhood trauma
attributes.background: The number of children experiencing abuse is much higher than acknowledged and is a serious issue in society, leading to addiction, crime and costing the NHS a huge amount. We can target the root of the problem and give teachers, people who see children day in day out, the skills to support and help

attributes.action: Ban the sale of all acid that burns the skin on contact
attributes.background: Today I walked into a discount home store and found acid on sale for £1.99. Thousands of lives destroyed for only £1.99.
attributes.additional_details: As a plumber I have used acid before and find it is dangerous even for me to use, even when standing back from it and reaching out to pour it down the drain it can still burn my eyes and face from the fumes. As a result I do not use it for cleaning drains, acid destroys the plug hole and all seals on the pipes. There is no need for it to be used for plumbing. Acids are used in a lot of items from lemons to drain cleaner, however some are diluted and would not cause harm, so i am asking for all acids that burn the skin instantly to be banned outright.

attributes.action: Ban all forms of gambling advertisements like the banning of tobacco commercials
attributes.background: The government is not doing enough to support people that are suffering from the severity of gambling addiction. Through numerous means, gambling organisations are targeting and taking advantage of  vulnerable gambling addicts by bombarding them with the temptation to give in to their impulses.
attributes.additional_details:
For the serious addict- a slogan that says 'When the Fun Stops, Stop' on the bottom of gambling adverts is not enough to rid any real impulse. The addict that is actively working on their recovery can find a single advert on the internet or TV extremely triggering.

The government has a responsibility to protect it's citizens in the face of corporations that are tactically taking advantage of addicts, particularly where gambling is readily available with a few taps on our mobile devices.

attributes.action: Make laws to prevent the fitting of excessively noisy exhausts to motor bikes
attributes.background: There are an increasing number of motorbikes and cars with exhausts that can be heard through double glazing and from over a quarter of a mile away. They disturb sleep, prevent conversation and cause stress. Their only purpose is to draw attention to the vehicle
attributes.additional_details:
A number of motorbikes and some cars frequently disturb me, often during the night or very early morning. Most people with whom I discuss this have also been disturbed.
One motorcyclist wakes me any time between 5:30 and 6:30am. He starts from his home, which I haven't yet identified, pushing his bike, and starts it up outside my house. He clearly knows it is too loud and avoids disturbing his own family.
The Chief Medical Officer has expressed concern about air and noise pollution.

attributes.action: Place a ban on companies demanding experience for 'factory floor' jobs.
attributes.background: Coffee houses, supermarkets, clothes stores and others demand experience to work on tills, stock shelves and make drinks. The average person can cook, clean, hang laundry and treat people decently. So, why do these daily tasks, skills and experiences need to be gained from previous employment?
attributes.additional_details:
If education is the key to a better life, then why is 'work experience' the lock keeping people barren. This may predominantly affect millennials, but it affects others too. There are people who want to work, but get rejected; when they just want to give back to society. 

If I can't obtain a job, due to a lack of work/job-related experience. Yet, to obtain work/job-related experience, I need a job. However, an employer won't hire me; due to a lack of work/job-related experience. Then the system becomes a punishment for those who desire knowledge and to be better & productive members of society.

attributes.action: alter law so that biological parents are legal guardian of their surrogate child
attributes.background: In the UK, the worrying thing about using your own embryo (which is biologically yours and your partners DNA) is that the surrogate is the legal guardian and can keep the child once born, if they decide to. I find this a scary thought after struggling to have my own child and considering surrogacy.
attributes.additional_details: If the embryo is biologically from the couple struggling with fertility and they choose to use a surrogate, there should be a law in place to say that baby is theirs legally and that the surrogate cannot keep the child once born. Couples struggling with infertility have enough to worry about without having their hopes dashed by a surrogate mother who may suddenly decide she doesn't want to part with the child once born, which would be devastating if the couple are biologically the 'real' parents

attributes.action: Support Chez Save A Life Methanol Awareness campaign.
attributes.background: After Cheznye passed away in Thailand in 2013, our family started a campaign to make other tourists aware of the risks of Methanol Poisoning when abroad. After countless discussions with the governmental figures they decided that Methanol Poisoning awareness was not a priority for them.
attributes.additional_details: As a family we have still tried to push Methanol Awareness but alone, our message doesn't spread far enough. 17 more tourists have suffered Methanol Posioning in Zante recently and I don't suspect this will be the last cases unless we create some awareness for tourists. We need support to from our government to raise awareness and save lives.

attributes.action: Condemn the Bangladeshi Government's violent crackdown on student protests.
attributes.background: The protests demanding more stringent road safety, were triggered when 2 students were killed by a speeding bus.The student-led protests are being targeted by state-sponsored violence. Bangladesh's government has also shut down access to mobile internet in many parts of the country in response.
attributes.additional_details:
The Telegraph and the BBC have noted the use of rubber bullets by the police. Online evidence, being shared by the protesters, also point to sexual assault and violent attacks carried out by the student wing of the ruling party, Awami League and the authorities.
Per the WHO, there are 20,000 road fatalities every year in Bangladesh. The government's violent crackdown is thought to be fueled by fears of anti-government sentiments leading up to the general election.

attributes.action: Reduce the eligibility of Police long service medal from 20 to 15 years
attributes.background:
Emergency services especially in current times face dangers day in and day out. But have to wait 5 years longer for any formal recognition.
It is proposed that the long service medal of both the police and fire service should be reduced from 20 years to 15 years exactly like the armed forces.

attributes.action: Free Glasses for anyone who needs them NO MATTER THE AGE! Especially students.
attributes.background: As if being a full time student on a budget isn’t hard enough, as soon as I reached 19 years old I was no longer allowed to receive free glasses. Obviously, this was very annoying seeing as I need them, because of my astigmatism I need special lenses which cost a FORTUNE!
attributes.additional_details: I personally believe that glasses should be free to whoever needs them if they cannot afford them, there should be some sort of scheme, not only the NHS. Appointments are free for students but after that you have to pay between £69-£200 for a pair of glassss not including the extra charges to get special lenses fitted in for anyone with eye deficiencies, like myself. If abortions & sex changes through the NHS are free, why do we have to pay for a pair of glasses? - Let’s make a change!

attributes.action: Require CCJs to be sent by recorded post
attributes.background: CCJs are just sent by normal post. If these are not received or sent to a previous address they are just entered against you. This is completely unfair which if you find out you have one, you then have to pay to get it set aside as you had no chance of defence. This needs to change.
attributes.additional_details: These need to at least be sent by recorded post and not entered if they are not received.

attributes.action: Take Pitbulls off the 1991 dangerous dog act.
attributes.background: Any dog can be dangerous, IF IT IS RAISED INCORRECTLY. Pitbulls shouldn’t be banned. It’s the owners fault for wrongly raising the dogs and action should be taken on owners and not the dogs.

attributes.action: All foods that contain gelatine must state what type of animal it is made from
attributes.background: I would like this to happen as many religions have certain foods that they are not allowed to eat.
attributes.additional_details:
Reading the ingredients on the back of food to check and it just says gelatine is not helpful. This petition is simple and wants companies to be required to specify what animal gelatine is in their products.

I really hope we can do this as a United Kingdom and bring together at least 10,000 signatures so we can get a written response from the Government!

attributes.action: Allow the disabled access to biodegradable single use plastics in any future ban
attributes.background: There has been a considerable number of concerns raised by the disabled community and allies about the need for single use plastics in their lives. I would like the language of any ban on any single use plastics to include an exemption for biodegradable plastics for the disabled community.

attributes.action: Ban the use of straws and plastic packaging in the UK
attributes.background: Plastic is polluting the ocean. Marine species then eat it causing plastic toxins to be absorbed into their body and enter the food chain. The plastic in their environment can also hurt the animals.

attributes.action: Fund Research to Prevent and Treat Asherman's Syndrome.
attributes.background: In 2009, I was pregnant with my one and only pregnancy. At my three-month scan, I was told there was no heartbeat and that I needed to have an ERPC. Following this I was diagnosed with Asherman's Syndrome, which then caused me to become infertile. This Silent Syndrome has been recognised since 1948.
attributes.additional_details: Asherman's Syndrome is scarring (adhesions) of the uterus. This scarring causes lighter periods or no periods at all and, in almost all women who are affected, infertility. It most often develops after a common minor operation called a D&C (dilation and curettage) and often following a missed miscarriage. In this case it's called an ERPC (evacuation of retained products of conception). It is estimated that around 60,000 - 100,000 D&Cs are carried out each year and many women remain undiagnosed.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to force staff to use their own credit card for company expenses
attributes.background:
More and more companies force / require employees to use their own funds and/or credit cards to fund company expenditure and to then claim back this expenditure after the fact.

The company's liability is then carried by the employee. 

The employee is responsible to the credit card company.
attributes.additional_details:
Companies then take weeks to pay the expenses - and in a lot of cases refuse to pay interest - forcing the employee to fund the expenses through their own current account (to avoid the expenses charge).
 
Having these expenses hidden makes the company’s balance sheet look more favourable than it is.
 
It is an abuse of the company’s power and when employees challenge it they are told there is no choice; no other option.

attributes.action: Mandate HMRC to say 'thank you' to small businesses
attributes.background: UK Entrepreneurs have started 5.7 million small businesses & employ more than 16 million people. Since 2010 alone they have created 2 million jobs. The blood, sweat and tears of these entrepreneurs goes unnoticed by HMRC, despite the huge tax contribution to the UK Govt. Just say thank you.
attributes.additional_details: Small business owners’ tax returns should say thank you for the VAT, the PAYE, the Employers NI and the Corporation Tax. This would recognise the risks they have taken to start their companies – as well as the sleepless nights, the sports days missed and the birthdays forgotten- and the contribution they make creating employment and contributing to our economy.

attributes.action: Give free sanitary products for girls in primary and secondary schools.
attributes.background: As the fifth largest economy no girls should be in a place where sanitary products are not available in school. As of next year Wales will give out free sanitary products to all girls in primary and secondary schools. It now time to follow in Wales footstep.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.walesonline.co.uk/news/wales-news/free-sanitary-products-given-schoolgirls-14805724

attributes.action: Lower the voting age to 13!!!
attributes.background: Teenagers should be allowed the right to vote. They are old enough to understand current world affairs and still young enough to be affected by it later on in their lives. They should be able to have a voice and decide their own future.

attributes.action: Hold a referendum to allow Northern England to claim independence.
attributes.background: Northern England is always the most underfunded out of everywhere in the UK. We in northern England pay taxes, yet it is always the south that spends it. We have the worst public transport system in the UK, and many other services including the NHS receive the smallest amount of funding in England.
attributes.additional_details:
Northern England should be allowed to hold a referendum on whether we should claim independence from England and form our own country within the UK.

Northern England is always forgotten about in the south including Downing Street. The government does not fund or maintain northern England properly as it should. 

We in northern England pay taxes, yet the south spends it. It is time to hold a referendum in Northern England !

attributes.action: Raise parent earning limit from individual to joint to enable equal childcare
attributes.background:
Government will provide 30hours a week free childcare. 1 condition is if an individual earns <£100k. 2 parents both earning <£100k can far exceed the gross income of a family where only 1 individual earns £100k+ e.g. £95k+£60k.

Petition is to enable £200k joint before family no longer qualifies.
attributes.additional_details:
Family A 
- Parent 1 £99k 
- Parent 2 £99k 
- Total = £198k 
- Household allowed 30 hours free child care

Family B 
- Parent 1 £101k 
- Parent 2 £15k 
- Total = £116k 
- Household is NOT entitled to free childcare (despite gross income £82k less!)
- Petition to ALLOW this type of scenario to qualify for free child care

This petition will enable Family B parent 2 to increase working hours by accessing equal childcare funding.

attributes.action: Include the welsh flag on the union jack
attributes.background: We must include wales in our community. they are a valuable member of the UK and they seem to be forgotten. i am not a welsh person myself but i think we can all agree they have a fine accent, also the best flag in the world. so why doesn't the UK include it. This HAS to change!
attributes.additional_details: It would be greatly appreciated if the UK government took this into consideration. i think we can all agree this would be a great thing

attributes.action: Renationalise all rail as they do not care for the consumer at all.
attributes.background: The new timetable that has been released has been a complete mess as their have been hunders of cancellations in peak times. They have removed services to blatantly avoid paying delay repay. Its abhorrent they get away with this and its about time the rail companies became publically owned.
attributes.additional_details: Check any timetable and you'll see the amount of services cancelled daily.

attributes.action: Do not ban 'cartoon characters' from 'unhealthy foods'.
attributes.background: MPs on the Health Committee wish to ban cartoon characters on 'unhealthy food' (such as Tony the Tiger & Nestle's Milky Bar Kid). These brand mascots have been around for decades yet obesity rates are only very high now due to bad parenting.
attributes.additional_details: Link to BBC Article - http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/health-44298135

attributes.action: Provide armed security for the Orthodox Jewish Community in the UK
attributes.background: European governments are providing armed security for synagogues and Jewish institutions following numerous fatal terror attacks. This is because where there is a serious risk of fatalities, the only feasible solution is to provide armed security for Jewish public places. The UK must do the same.
attributes.additional_details:
The Terror threat level in Europe is getting worse, with innocent people of all races being murdered. The threat to the Jewish community is always greater, in particular when elements of the media promote anti-semitic perspectives on the Middle East conflict. The Gov't Provides armed Police for Foreign embassies and must do the same for it's own citizens who need it.

It is impossible for a policeman or security guard without a weapon to protect sites from  terrorists armed with weapons.

attributes.action: Ban the sale of confectionery at the checkout in all UK shops
attributes.background: The UK is facing a huge obesity crisis, which is placing increasing pressure on the NHS. This petition calls for a ban on the sale of confectionery at the checkout in all UK shops (excluding confectionery shops) to stop consumers impulse buying confectionery they would otherwise not have bought.
attributes.additional_details:
The obesity crisis that the UK is facing is unprecedented. To tackle this issue, more preventative measures ought to be taken. This petition offers such an idea. A simple idea, but one that can make a difference.
References: 
BBC programme - Britain's Fat Fight with Hugh Fearnley-Whittingstall
Article: http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/health-43838655
NHS on obesity: https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/obesity/
Find out your BMI: http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/health-43697948
See also NHS Digital UK obesity stats.

attributes.action: UK Government to create a scheme to help people to manage their gambling.
attributes.background: Gambling was legalised in 1961 for better government control and to allow SMALL bets to be placed. There are 450k-2million problem gamblers that effect 2-10million people in the UK. Can i suggest that the UK government considers the introduction of a 'gambling card' that will control gambling.
attributes.additional_details: I believe there is a 'conflict of interest' letting betting companies deal with 'Self exclusion' and 'Affordability checks'. Betting companies do not identify problem gamblers and there is no instructions how they could identify problem gamblers. Amounts placed and frequency is not monitored. Could the government, working with betting firms, consider a 'gambling card' be introduced based on someone's income. Gambling is not FUN if someone can lose more than they can afford to.

attributes.action: Grants for wash/dry toilets installed in households. Stop use of wipes/tissue.
attributes.background: There is currently a lot  in the media about how harmful the use of toilet wipes is on the environment and marine life. It is also costly to clear up and provide necessary protection. Providing access to grant aided/discounted wash and dry toilets should help to greatly minimise this. SaveOurPlanet!

attributes.action: Improve school lunch standards to ensure all children eat lunch
attributes.background: I have raised concern over many school children not eating lunch during school. This is due to unappetizing and unhygienic meals which put's the school children off of their food. This is a major concern because the school children are missing out on vital nutrients required to grow.
attributes.additional_details: Not only do the children find the food disgusting and extremely unappetizing, both teachers and parents have also commented on the situation and are worried about the health of students from leaving out such vital nutrients. Without a sustainable amount of energy, school children will be unable to concentrate during lessons which may affect their education.

attributes.action: A fresh look at Hi-tech solutions to reduce traffic congestion nationwide.
attributes.background:
Using roads sensibly will save most people money and will help save lives; according to the BBC article 1 in 6 deaths worldwide are due to pollution. 
We want the government to look at solutions available today that can dramatically reduce congestion, such as a smart phone app for car sharing.
attributes.additional_details:
Using a Car share app on a phone provides high levels of safety and an alternate lift home if necessary. 

The government is obliged to improve air quality.  http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-38990192
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/health-41678533

Using DfT report from 2005, an example an average car travelling 20 miles each day with 3 occupants, will save £1,000 per occupant per year.  
http://webarchive.nationalarchives.gov.uk/+/http:/www.dft.gov.uk/pgr/sustainable/cars/makingcarsharingmarch2005.pdf

attributes.action: Prohibit operating tractors & other agricultural vehicles between 07:30 - 09:00
attributes.background: A tailback of cars stretching miles behind a tractor during rush hour in the morning is a sight many of the British public are accustomed to. Their use not only causes huge delays to travel times but puts other drivers at risk of incident as a result of forced manoeuvre.
attributes.additional_details: Many of us have experienced considerable delays due to these vehicles, whose operation at peak rush hour is generally dispensible and subservient at these hours. Tractors also breed anger into the drivers who are stuck behind them, with no hope of manoeuvring unless subjecting themselves to an incident. The difference in time between agricultural vehicles travelling at 8am rather than 9am is negligible and should be considered when contemplating this petition.

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement for horse owners to pick up their horse droppings
attributes.background: Living in a rural village in Berkshire I often see a lot of horse pooh in the road and never once a person cleaning it up, after my 6 and 8 year old sons pointing this out, why dog owners do why don’t horse owners it is unsanitary to surely in this day and age?

attributes.action: Make a law on age for babysitting and being left home alone
attributes.background: As confusing as it is some people think it's wrong to let teenagers under 16 look after their siblings or other young children, whilst others see no harm As it can be good to trust these days and at other times there are risks..
attributes.additional_details:
Do we educate our children how to deal with emergencies when they arise or how to cook their own food without setting fire to the kitchen.
Just think a law should be in place to protect not only the children but others around and make it a legal age to babysit

attributes.action: Force all local councils to offer a dedicated plastic waste bin
attributes.background: In the wake of the current plastic crisis I find it staggering that there are still councils like mine in Swindon that do not provide people with a dedicated plastic waste bin.
attributes.additional_details: For example in Swindon if we wish to recycle plastic we have to buy white bin bags and then the waste will be collected. No it doesn't cost much but it is obviously enough to put people off and that is evident every bin collection day. So while the government think about what the consumer can do to help the issue with plastic bottle return points, I think they need to also look at what they should be doing and this is a simple step already offered by other councils.

attributes.action: Urge Thameslink not to makes changes to timetable
attributes.background: Thameslink are planning in May to change the timetables which will mean that commuters will be delayed with for work etc

attributes.action: Ban the use of high-frequency sonic deterrents against young people
attributes.background:
'Mosquitos' are devices deployed outside shops in public areas, with the aim of deterring loitering. They output high-energy 17400Hz waves, only heard by children and young adults.

This 108-decibel assault is painful, causes headaches, and discriminates against all young people.
attributes.additional_details:
Mosquito use infringes on section 14 (discrimination) of the European Convention on Human Rights and the Human Rights Act 1998. The Council of Europe has recommended in 2010 that it be banned.

Mosquito emissions are irritating, painful, and have been compared to forms of torture.

Kent County Council have already banned these on council-owned buildings - why are the Government not at least doing the same?

attributes.action: Hold a referendum for devolution in the North of England.
attributes.background: In 2004 the North East of England had a devolution referendum. Due to the small turnout the same referendum for the North West of England was never held. It is the opinion of many that the socio-economic divide between the North and the South of England has grown exponentially over the past decade.
attributes.additional_details: With growing cases of the North not having their issues and needs fairly addressed in the Southern biased Parliament, it is time that a referendum is held to offer those citizens North of the River Trent an opportunity to vote on devolution. This will provide a platform for issues relevant to the North of England to be considered without an underlying London-centricity.

attributes.action: Make political education compulsory in secondary schools.
attributes.background: In our politics class we have been debating the crisis of participation and the democratic deficit. We feel that a lack of political participation is caused partly by a lack of political education - so people don't understand how important it is to make their voice heard through voting.

attributes.action: Bring in a recognised standard of safety for installation of blinds.
attributes.background: For years the blind industry has the good and the bad installers, which is the same in a lot of industries but this can be the case of life or death when cords are involved.
attributes.additional_details: There are many cases of children losing their lives to poorly installed blinds due to the cording.

attributes.action: Make GBL a higher class than cannabis, currently only a class C
attributes.background: A lot of people have died from the date rape drug GBL yet it’s only a class C and available to buy got cleaning purposes off the internet.
attributes.additional_details: Please help me get backing for this share it as much as you like. I’ve lost too many people to the drug and don’t see how it’s a lower class than cannabis.

attributes.action: More effort to increase the peace process between Israel and Palestine
attributes.background: The UK Government should carry out a detailed review of all its efforts towards facilitating the peace process between Israel and Palestine. This review should identify what hasn’t been done and recommend new action that the Government could take.
attributes.additional_details: For so long people have seen these two states as enemies and for too long innocent people have been brought into a conflict which deeply effects the progression of life in this area of the world. It is time for this to stop.
